front.title: LPWAN Static Context Header Compression (SCHC) for CoAP

abstract.t: This draft defines the way SCHC header compression can be applied to CoAP headers. CoAP header structure differs from IPv6 and UDP protocols since the CoAP use a flexible header with a variable number of options themselves of a variable length. Another important difference is the asymmetry in the header format used in request and response messages. Most of the compression mechanisms have been introduced in [I-D.ietf-lpwan-ipv6-static-context-hc], this document explains how to use the SCHC compression for CoAP.
